plugins.name: Frame Generator
plugins.description:
Frame Generator simplifies the process of creating responsive design frames for web and mobile layouts directly in Figma. With just a click, this plugin generates three frames—Desktop, Tablet, and Mobile—complete with predefined grid layouts to match standard design practices.


Key Features:

  1. Automatically generates frames for Desktop (1440px), Tablet (768px), and Mobile (375px) sizes.
  2. Pre-configured grid layouts for each frame, ensuring consistency and alignment.
  3. Customizable spacing and columns for flexible design systems.
  4. Streamlines your workflow for responsive design projects.


Perfect for designers who need to quickly create responsive layouts without manual adjustments.
plugins.tagline: Create Desktop, Tablet & Mobile Base Layout

plugins.name: FigmaCardify
plugins.description:
Introducing FigmaCardify, the lightning-fast postcard component library designed specifically for social media apps like Twitter. With FigmaCardify, building eye-catching media cards has never been easier. Choose from a curated selection of pre-built card variations, each optimized to showcase your media content flawlessly.


Efficiency is at the core of FigmaCardify. Toggle effortlessly between light and dark modes to match the aesthetic of your social media platform. Quickly adjust the number of images to suit your needs, ensuring your cards capture attention with the perfect visual balance.


Our plugin empowers you to streamline your design process, saving valuable time while delivering professional-quality results. Simply select your desired card variant, drop in your media, and watch as FigmaCardify magically assembles a beautifully composed layout.


Whether you're promoting a new product, sharing captivating visuals, or engaging with your audience, FigmaCardify offers an intuitive interface that lets you create stunning media cards with ease. Leave a lasting impression on your Twitter followers with visually appealing and on-brand content.


Unlock the power of efficient design and elevate your social media presence with FigmaCardify. Get started today and experience the speed and simplicity of crafting striking media cards that stand out on Twitter.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly design stunning postcards with time-saving layouts.

plugins.name: Doist Utilities
plugins.description:
A plugin of utility functions for use with the Doist marketing design system.


It's unlikely that this plugin will be that useful to you since the color styles and components it references are specific to the Doist brand design system, but feel free to try it out anyway!


Utility functions:

  • set node to parent width/height/both
  • apply basic screenshot styles to image or frame
  • format monochromatic illustrations to be tintable with fills
  • show/hide annotation components
  • resize spacing component using the Brand spacing scale
  • create and name slices for icon export
  • append language codes to frames created by the Transifex plugin
  • Replace text with skeleton shapes

accepted.name: Doist

plugins.name: Layer Renamer
plugins.description:
Hello, I am a designer. In my work, I often need to rename different product components with specified product numbers. Manually doing this is a massive task, so I used AI to develop this plugin (I have no coding skills). You can input multiple names directly into the plugin's input field or copy multiple names from Excel or other text tools and paste them into the input field. Names should be separated by spaces. This allows you to batch rename the selected layers in order.


How to Use:

· Open the plugin in Figma.

· Enter or paste the desired layer names in the input field.

· Select the layers you want to rename in Figma.

· Click the "Rename Layers" button to apply the new names.


Limitations:

· Ensure the number of names matches the number of selected layers to avoid naming errors.

· The renaming order follows the layer hierarchy from bottom to top.

· The plugin automatically removes special characters not supported in Windows file names during renaming.

· Save your work before batch renaming to prevent any unintended changes.
plugins.tagline: Rename selected layers using input names to boost workflow efficiency

plugins.name: Alwan
plugins.description:
About Alwan

Alwan is your custom controlled random color generator.You can use Alwan to control what range of colors to apply randomly on selected elements. Effortlessly apply dynamic colors to selected elements with custom HSL Range values.


Features

Customize, Select, Apply!

  • Apply random colors to fills and strokes of selected elements.
  • Choose and control on what to apply from a variety of element types

- All : All elements selected (Including Group children)

- Rectangles : All rectangles selected

- Ellipses : All ellipses selected

- Polygons : All polygons selected

- Stars : All stars selected.

Text : All texts selected


  • Customize HSL ranges to control the color spectrum.
  • Instantly apply random colors with a single click.
  • Choose a HSL Preset to apply on selected elements.


Alwan streamlines the color design process, adding an element of spontaneity to your Figma workflow.


Instructions


Color Range

  • If you want to manually customize the color range than in the Custom Tab
  1. Customize Hue, Saturation & Lightness ranges using the sliders or manually input the values.
  2. Setup your Target Preferences.
  3. Click “Apply on x selected elements”.


  • If you want to use one of the Range Presets
  1. Choose which preset you want to apply Full Spectrum, Vibrant, Neon, Pastel, Light & Dark Colors.
  2. Setup your Target Preferences.
  3. Click “Apply on x selected elements”.


Target Preferences

  • Define where to apply colors : Fills / Strokes
  • Define the element type you want to be affected by the random colors.


Please note: If you did not set a certain range for the colors, the plugin will automatically apply the full range for Hue, Saturation & Lightness. 


Experiment with different settings to discover new color combinations.


You can reach me out for feedback and bug reports at hello@brahimr.com or via my personal contact form at https://brahimr.com/contact.


Thank you and happy randomizing!
plugins.tagline: Apply random colors to fills and strokes of selected elements within a custom HSL range.

plugins.name: orgaNICE! - Organize & label everything into sections!
plugins.description:
orgaNICE is a simple but powerful plugin that helps you structure your Figma files by creating clean, consistent section containers for your designs with automatic header labels for each selected item in a single click!


Pretty NICE for designers who want to maintain an organized and professional workspace!


Support this project - Thanks :)


How It Works:

  1. Select the items you wish to organize
  2. Open orgaNICE! plugin
  3. Add a section title
  4. Press Organize and done!


Features:

  1. ⚡ Quick Clean-up: Create organized sections for any item with a single click


  1. 🎨 Color Presets: Save and reuse custom colors for background and header text


  1. 🔠 Layout options: Select between horizontal, vertical & wrap layout for the output section


  1. 💾 Settings Persistence: Simple stuff, basically keeps the last used settings as the default setting to make your life easier


  1. 🅰️ Header Text: Automatically add header titles to each frame with customizable text size and color


  1. 👥 Settings Sharing: Copy and paste settings between team members for consistent styling across projects


Perfect for design teams who want to establish and maintain organizational standards across projects and team members.
plugins.tagline: Arrange frames, componets, sections, images, etc into a customisation section

plugins.name: Codia AI Office: Import Office File to Editable Figma
plugins.description:
Simplify Your Design Workflow with the Office to Editable Figma Plugin——The ideal solution for quickly converting your Office files into fully editable Figma layers. This tool enhances efficiency, precision, and security when transitioning from Office to Figma.


Key Features and Advantages


Fast Conversion

Instantly import your Office files into Figma with minimal loading times, speeding up your design process without sacrificing quality.


Fully Editable Layers

Every element from your Office file is converted into fully editable layers in Figma, ensuring you have complete control over adjustments and iterations.


High Compatibility & Perfect Conversion

Enjoy seamless compatibility between Office and Figma. The plugin ensures that all your design elements, including fonts, effects, and layer structures, are perfectly preserved during the transition.


Privacy Protection

Your files are handled securely throughout the import process, ensuring that your designs remain private and protected.


Supports Multiple Office Formats

Convert a wide range of Office file formats, including .doc / .docx / .docm / .dotx / .dot / .ppt / .pptx / .pptm / .pps / .ppsx / .pot / .potx / .odp / .pages / .key / .wps / .odt / .wpd / .abw / .xls / .xlsx / .xlsb / .xlsm / .xlt / .xltm / .xltx / .csv / .ods, ensuring flexibility across different document types.


Streamline Your Design Process

Using the Office to Editable Figma Plugin will revolutionize your workflow, saving you valuable time and effort. Instead of manually recreating designs in Figma or struggling with compatibility issues, this plugin automates the process, delivering pixel-perfect conversions with full layer editability.


Whether you’re part of a team collaborating on projects or working solo, the ability to instantly convert Office files ensures smoother design handoffs and iterations. With fast, accurate, and secure file conversions, you can focus more on creativity and collaboration, knowing your designs are perfectly preserved across platforms.


Call to Action☎️

For support issues: Slack Twitter Email Codia.AI

accepted.name: Codia.AI
accepted.description: Anything to Design, Anything to Code.

plugins.name: Tokeno
plugins.description:
Overview:

Tokeno is a versatile Figma plugin designed to streamline the conversion of local variables into usable code snippets. With Tokeno, designers can effortlessly extract variable names and their corresponding values from Figma's local variables collection. The plugin then transforms this data into JSON format, offering seamless integration with development workflows. Moreover, Tokeno facilitates the conversion of JSON data into TypeScript (ts) and SCSS files, optimizing the transfer of design tokens into code.


Key Features:

  1. Local Variable Extraction: Tokeno simplifies the process of gathering variable names and values directly from Figma's local variables collection.
  2. JSON Conversion: The extracted data is automatically formatted into JSON, ensuring compatibility and ease of use across different platforms and environments.
  3. Code Generation: Tokeno empowers users to effortlessly convert JSON data into TypeScript (ts) and SCSS files, streamlining the transition of design tokens into development-ready code.


User Interface:

Tokeno boasts an intuitive user interface featuring two prominent buttons:

  1. Download TS: This button enables users to instantly download the generated TypeScript (ts) file containing the extracted local variables in a structured format.
  2. Download SCSS: With a single click, users can download the generated SCSS file, facilitating seamless integration of design tokens into SCSS-based projects.
plugins.tagline: Tokeno: Bridging Design and Code Seamlessly.

plugins.name: Relative changes
plugins.description:
Change multiple values of nodes that show "Mixed" in the GUI with custom calculations.


Select the nodes you want to change and apply the changes of your calculations.


  • It resolves the limitation of applying changes to nodes which have mixed property values.
  • It provides usable variables from the node's properties value. You can use the width of the node as a multiple in your changes.
  • It provides a way to apply changes to nodes in a group, without affecting those individual elements. You do not have to create a new group to modify the elements, since doing so would extract those nodes from their respective group(s).

plugins.name: Redact
plugins.description:
Redact is your go-to Figma plugin for transforming text into clean, minimalist blocks, perfect for low-fidelity wireframes and abstract design concepts. It takes paragraphs, headlines, or any text, and replaces them with rectangles styled to match the original dimensions and colour. plugins.name: Paginate — Add page numbers in one click
plugins.description:
Helps you add page numbers to YOUR design in one click. Perfect for presentations, PDFs, and multi-page layouts.


How it works


Step 1. Name Your Text Layer

Use a specific layer name for your text, or copy the one the plugin suggests. The plugin will replace it with the page number.


Step 2. Arrange frames in a Z-pattern (left to right, then top to bottom).


Step 3. (Optional) Settings:

  1. Choose ascending or descending order
  2. Set starting number (e.g., 2,3,4 or 43,44,45)
  3. Increment numbers (e.g., 1,3,5 or 1,5,9)
  4. Define digit format (1,2,3 or 01,02,03)
  5. Select number type (Arabic numerals or Roman numerals)


Step 4. Select the frames that need page numbers. Click Paginate and watch your layers update instantly!



Additional Info:

Feedback, suggestions, and feature requests are welcome in comments!

Inspired by "PageNum" by Resul Celik, with added features.

accepted.name: Neha Gupta
accepted.description: An itch to solve problems and make lives better.

plugins.tagline: Smart page numbering for Figma layers in seconds

plugins.description:
This visual color palette picker plugin is your one-stop shop for creating stunning color schemes!


The ultimate visual color palette creator! Craft harmonious color combinations with a user-friendly interface that provides a real-time visual preview. Explore a wide range of colors and find the perfect match for your project.


Visually select colors: Move beyond clunky code pickers. Use intuitive color wheels, spectrums, and even gradient pickers to find just the right shades.


Real-time preview: See how your chosen colors look in action! Instantly preview your selections on a design mock-up or within your application interface.


Craft perfect palettes: Don't just pick one color - build a whole harmonious scheme! Create custom palettes and save them for future projects, ensuring brand consistency.

plugins.name: Typable
plugins.description:
Make your Figma forms work like the real thing 🚀


Tired of static form designs? Typable transforms your Figma prototypes into fully interactive, typable experiences. With just one click, you can add input fields, validation, and a submit button, making your forms functional and testable directly inside Figma.


Typable takes full advantage of Figma’s native variable functionality, automatically setting up and managing all necessary components and variables behind the scenes. No need to manually configure anything — just focus on designing and let Typable handle the technical details.


🔥 Why use Typable?


✅ Bring your prototypes to life

Let users type into input fields and interact with your forms as they would in a real product.


✅ Effortless form validation

Set required fields, add custom error messages, and guide users with real-time feedback.


✅ One-click setup

Instantly generate fully functional form components without complex setup or plugins.


✅ Test like a pro

Get realistic usability feedback by allowing users to fill out forms and submit them inside Figma.


✨ Key Features


📝 Typable input fields

Add real input fields that users can type into during prototypes.


⚡ Customizable form elements

Define labels, placeholder text, and default values.


🚨 Error handling

Set mandatory fields and display custom error messages on submit.


🎯 Success feedback

Show entered values on a success screen when all fields are correctly filled.


🎨 Seamless Figma integration

Works effortlessly inside your design workflow, no extra tools needed.


Upcoming updates:

  1. Adding more interactive components: textarea, checkbox, radio, toggle, dropdown
  2. Adding support for mobile keyboards

plugins.name: HCT Palette
plugins.description:
Create accessible color palettes for your design system in no time, with the help of HCT, a perceptual uniform color space.


How to Use:

  1. Input Your Base Color: Enter a color in HEX, RGB, or HSL format, and the plugin will automatically generate the corresponding HCT color.
  2. Name Your Palette: Give your palette a descriptive name such as “primary,” “success,” or “danger.”
  3. Customize Tones: The tool generates tones from 0 to 100 by default, in increments of 10. To add custom tones, simply input the desired value and press enter.
  4. Remove Tones: Hover over any tone and click the “X” to remove it from the palette.
  5. Add to Canvas: Click the "Add to Canvas" button to place the color palette directly onto your Figma canvas.
  6. Add to Variables: Click the "Add to Variables" button to add the colors palette as Figma's variables.


Check out the article Building an Accessible Color System to learn more about creating and refining color palettes, and building an accessible color system out of it.


HCT Color Space:

HCT (Hue, Chroma, Tone) is a perceptually uniform color space developed by Google. It combines the CAM16 model for hue and chroma with the CIELAB (D65) color space's tone (lightness), ensuring consistent visual representation across hues. By converting complex contrast ratios into simple tonal differences, HCT makes it easy to meet accessibility standards—just select colors with enough tonal contrast!


Explore More on HCT:

  1. The Science Behind HCT and Color Design
  2. Handbook of Color Psychology
plugins.tagline: Generate accessible color palettes instantly with HCT color space.

plugins.name: Solo - Portrait Background Remove
plugins.description:
Remove Backgrounds from Images for Free

Using the latest in machine learning models, this tool allows you to select any Figma node, then remove the background from the foreground instantly and freely.


Simply.

  1. Select the Figma objects with images that you'd like to remove the background from
  2. Right click and run "solo" from the plugins menu
  3. Wait and in a few seconds your image will be ready and replaced.


Solo runs all image processing on-device in Figma, so your images are fully secure and never leave your device.


Note

As this plugin uses cutting edge machine learning models, it may not be compatible with all devices and browsers and will likely have variable results on images. Apologies in advance if it doesn't work for you!


I've found this model works best on people rather than foreground objects.
plugins.tagline: Remove background from any image in Figma for free and securely, on-device.

plugins.name: Multiple font resizer
plugins.description:
Multiple font resizer


This plugin allows you to easily adjust the size of selected text elements.

You can increase or decrease the font size by the amount you assign with just one click.


Instructions for use:

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Run the plugin and choose whether you want to increase or decrease the font size.
  3. The plugin will automatically adjust the size and load the necessary fonts.


Recommendation: For better results, it's recommended to select only text elements, avoiding the selection of "groups" or "frames" (that contain text).


Warning: This plugin is in beta, which means it may not work perfectly in all cases.


By Nicolás Agüero.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly adjust the size of multiple text elements to your preferred value with a single click

plugins.name: Instancer - Bulk generate instances from a component
plugins.description:
Instancer - Bulk generate instances from a component


Transform any Figma component/Instance/ComponentSet into a comprehensive Table showing every possible variant combination. Instancer allows you to Explore all your component states in one clear, labeled layout.


Features :


  1. Auto-Generate All Variants - Creates every possible component combination instantly
  2. Smart Property Controls - Choose which properties to include or exclude from generation
  3. Live Combination Counter - See total possible variants and nested instances at a glance
  4. Toggle-Based Filtering - Use switches to turn properties on/off for precise control
  5. Organized Matrix Layout - Clean grid arrangement makes all combinations easy to scan
  6. Clear Instance Labels - Every variant shows exactly which properties are active
  7. One-Click Generation - Select any component and generate complete variant overview instantly


Its a one-stop pit stop for reviewing design system completeness and consistency.


How to use instancer :


  1. Select any component/instance/variant from your Figma file
  2. Plugin preview window displays the selected component and shows all available properties and variants
  3. Use toggle controls to choose which properties to include in generation
  4. Click "Generate" to create your possible combination
  5. Voilà! All possible combinations are instantly created in an organized, labeled layout.


Pricing :


Free : Up to 10 free generations to explore and test the plugin.

Premium : Unlimited generations at a price of coffee.
plugins.tagline: Generate all your component possibilities with ease

plugins.name: Image Alt Text Generator
plugins.description:
Alt Text Generator for Figma


This plugin helps you automatically generate alt text for images in your Figma designs, enhancing accessibility and user experience. It can generate alt text for individual images, multiple images, or all images on the page at once. The images are converted into Components, and the generated alt text is stored in the description field of each image. Developers can easily access this alt text in Dev Mode for seamless integration into code.


Note: Requires an OpenAI API Key for alt text generation. You can sign up and get your API key at OpenAI.
plugins.tagline: Automatically generate alt text for images

plugins.name: LaLo: the Localizer
plugins.description:
The Localizer easily helps you abstracting your Figma project to the locale with the use of labels.

You can also translate your project downloading the input file from a Weblate server (e.g. https://weblate.literallyalocalizer.com) or choosing between an input json file or a multi selection of *_##.arb files (e.g. app_en.arb) with requested locales (both LCID and ISO 639-1).


Here an example of input json file:

{
"en": {
"app_login": "Login",
"app_color": "Colour"
},
"it": {
"app_login": "Accedi",
"app_color": "Colore"
},
"en_US": {
"app_login": "Login",
"app_color": "Color"
},
"fr": {
"app_login": "Connexion",
"app_color": "Couleur"
},
"es": {
"app_login": "Iniciar sesión",
"app_color": "Color"
},
"de": {
"app_login": "Anmelden",
"app_color": "Farbe"
},
"pt": {
"app_login": "Entrar",
"app_color": "Cor"
},
"zh": {
"app_login": "登录",
"app_color": "颜色"
},
"ja": {
"app_login": "ログイン",
"app_color": "色"
},
"ko": {
"app_login": "로그인",
"app_color": "색깔"
},
"ru": {
"app_login": "Войти",
"app_color": "Цвет"
},
"ar": {
"app_login": "تسجيل الدخول",
"app_color": "لون"
}
}
plugins.tagline: Literally a Localizer Figma plugin
